home.about_me: Here I have created a platform to present my educational and professional activities with comprehensive details. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

introduction.name: My name is Chad Feierstein
introduction.bio: My name is Chad Feierstein, I come from magical Luxembourg and currently live in Rumelange. My passion for technology drives me to constantly explore new technologies and to continuously develop myself. One of my outstanding qualities is that I enjoy learning. This has always helped me in my school career so far and I am convinced that it will also be of great benefit in the world of information technology.

programming.title: Programming
programming.description: I enjoy developing innovative solutions and continuously deepening my skills in this area.

learning.title: Learning
learning.description: Expanding my knowledge in the field of information technology, always striving to deepen my understanding and skills.

dogs.title: My dogs
dogs.description: In my free time, I am passionate about my three faithful companions, even enjoying their company on my vacations. Names: Grimmel, Fusel, Popeye

sectionWork.title: Work
sectionWork.description: I was able to gain several years of professional experience. I was able to work on projects both independently and as part of a team.

items.title: Looking for a job in computer science
items.description: I am looking for exciting challenges: Looking for new career opportunities in the IT industry to gain valuable experience and develop my skills.

items.title: IT Cloud Engineer
items.description: An internship at QPark Consulting, where I worked on two large projects for three months.

tasks.name: Creating a plan for a project using agile methods
Creation and configuration of virtual machines (Google Cloud Platform)
Implementing a website in a virtual machine (Google Cloud Platform)
Implementing a static website on AWS S3 bucket for cost efficiency (Amazon Web Services)
Retrieve and transform data from an existing REST API (Amazon Web Services)

The new telephone connections in the rack room were connected according to plan

sectionOtherSkills.title: Other skills
sectionOtherSkills.description: Programs, software, services and other things that I used during my education, study or work.

items.title: Public Cloud Provider
items.description: Experience with providers of public cloud services.
A scalable cloud storage service that allows users to securely store and retrieve data and objects.
A scalable cloud computing service that provides virtual server instances to run applications that require computing resources.
A managed service that makes it easy to set up, operate and scale relational databases in the cloud, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle or SQL Server.
An isolated network in the AWS cloud that allows users to operate resources such as EC2 instances in a defined, private environment.
A service that simplifies the deployment and scaling of web applications and services by automatically managing resources such as EC2 instances, load balancers, and scale sets.
A user access and permissions management service in AWS that allows administrators to manage users, groups, and policies to control access to AWS resources.
A serverless computing service that allows developers to run code without having to worry about deploying or managing servers.
A scalable and flexible service for creating and managing virtual machines (VMs) running on Google's infrastructure.
Azure offers a variety of Linux VMs that are flexible and scalable.
In addition to Linux VMs, Azure also offers a wide range of Windows VMs.
A service for hosting static web applications and websites in Azure.
Azure Functions is a serverless service that allows developers to run code based on events or requests without having to worry about the underlying infrastructure.

items.title: Virtualization
items.description: Experience with Type 1
A hypervisor that runs directly on physical hardware and can host multiple virtual machines.
An open source virtualization platform based on Linux and using KVM.
Desktop virtualization software for running VMs on a host operating system.
Free virtualization software for running VMs on a host operating system.
A container platform for packaging and running applications and their dependencies.
An orchestration tool for managing Docker container clusters.
An open source orchestration system for automating container deployment and management.

items.title: Operating systems
items.description: The operating systems with which I have gained experience so far.
An operating system developed by Microsoft that was widely used and used for many years.
A version of Microsoft Windows with a redesigned user interface concept optimized specifically for touchscreens.
Microsoft's current operating system, which offers a variety of features and improvements compared to its predecessors.
The latest version of Microsoft Windows with updated design and new features.
A server version of Microsoft Windows designed specifically for use in corporate environments.
Another server version of Microsoft Windows with improved features for business use.
The latest server version of Microsoft Windows with advanced business features and cloud integration.
A popular Linux distribution known for its ease of use and versatility.
A stable and widely used Linux distribution that serves as the basis for many other distributions.
A Linux distribution specializing in penetration testing and security audits.
An operating system developed by the Raspberry Pi Foundation that is specifically optimized for use on the Raspberry Pi computer.
The operating system that runs on Cisco network devices such as routers and switches and manages network connectivity and functions.

items.title: Office software
items.description: A deep insight into Microsoft Office and my extensive knowledge of it.
A word processing program for creating and editing all kinds of documents.
A spreadsheet application for managing data, creating charts, and performing calculations.
A presentation software for creating and editing visually appealing presentations.
A database application for managing and analyzing large amounts of data.
An email and organization application to manage emails, appointments and contacts.
A teamwork communication platform that offers chat, video calling, file sharing and real-time collaboration.
A cloud storage service for storing, syncing and sharing files and folders.

items.title: programming
items.description: The range of my skills in different programming languages.
A command line shell and scripting language developed by Microsoft specifically designed for system administration and automation in Windows environments.
The Bourne-Again Shell (Bash) is a standard shell for Unix-based operating systems such as Linux and macOS, providing a powerful command-line interface and scripting capabilities.
A versatile and user-friendly programming language known for its simplicity, readability and extensive standard library.
Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) is a markup language for structuring web pages and content on the World Wide Web.
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language for designing the appearance of HTML and XML documents.
A programming language commonly used for developing interactive websites and applications.
A server-side scripting language primarily used for developing dynamic websites and web applications.
Structured Query Language (SQL) is a special programming language for managing and querying relational databases.

items.title: Project management
items.description: Core concepts and important aspects that make up project management.
This includes defining project goals, scope, schedule, resource requirements, budget and risks.
The identification, assessment and treatment of risks that could influence the course of the project and the project result.
Effective communication is crucial to keep the team, stakeholders and other stakeholders informed about project progress, changes, issues and decisions.
Allocating and managing resources such as staff, budget, equipment and materials to ensure the project is completed on time and within budget.
Planning and monitoring schedules to ensure project goals and milestones are achieved in a timely manner.
Planning, monitoring and ensuring the quality of project products and results in accordance with requirements and standards.
Identifying, engaging and managing the interests and expectations of all stakeholders, including customers, team members, suppliers and other stakeholders.
Managing changes in project scope, schedule or budget.
Leading, motivating and developing the project team to ensure effective collaboration and performance.

The closing phase includes completing all project activities, delivering final products to the customer, and conducting follow-up to reflect on experiences, identify learning points, and document best practices for future projects.

details.category: Connection between project management and JIRA

items.description: These aspects of project management are closely related and must work in harmony to ensure the success of a project.

items.title: IT network
items.description: Expertise in network planning, setup and maintenance for reliable communications.
Basics of networks, their architectures, topologies and protocols.
Understanding of OSI layer model and TCP/IP protocol.
Functions and configuration of network devices such as switches and routers.
IPv4 and possibly also introduction to IPv6, IP address classes, subnetting and addressing schemes.
Basic network protocols like ICMP, ARP, DHCP, DNS and how they work.
Configuration and management of LANs, Ethernet technologies, VLANs and their configuration.
Basics of WANs, serial connections, PPP and HDLC.
Introduction to network security concepts, authentication, encryption, and basic security measures.
Network management basics, configuration and monitoring tools, troubleshooting and diagnostics.
Practical application of the knowledge learned through laboratories and simulations to carry out configurations and implement networks.
Deepen the concepts of routing and switching, including configuring routers and switches.
Advanced knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 routing protocols such as RIP, OSPF and EIGRP.
How STP works and how to avoid loops in network topologies.
In-depth configuration and management of VLANs as well as the implementation of routing between VLANs.
Using ACLs to control network access and security.
Configuring and managing DHCP for automatic IP address assignment.
Understanding and configuring NAT to convert private IP addresses into public IP addresses.
Introduction to various WAN technologies such as HDLC, PPP, Frame Relay and possibly VPNs.
Advanced troubleshooting techniques and diagnostic procedures for network problems.
Concepts and techniques for scaling networks to support larger and more complex environments.
In-depth configuration of VLANs and trunking, including the use of VTP.
Increased understanding of Variable Length Subnet Masking (VLSM) and its application to IPv4 addressing schemes.
Advanced aspects of IPv6, including addressing, configuration, and integration into IPv4 networks.
In-depth knowledge and configuration of routing protocols such as OSPF, EIGRP and possibly BGP.
Advanced configuration of WAN technologies such as PPP, Frame Relay and possibly MPLS.
Advanced security concepts and techniques, including implementing ACLs, routing-level security, and securing network devices.
Advanced network monitoring, management and diagnostics, including the use of SNMP and Syslog.
In-depth skills in diagnosing and troubleshooting network issues in complex environments.

items.title: IT security
items.description: Competence in securing IT networks for protected communication.
Basics of historical encryption methods to illustrate cryptographic principles.
Use of tools such as HexViewers, BitLocker and Microsoft EFS for file encryption and security of sensitive data.
Implementation of end-to-end encryption (PGP, GPG) to secure email communications.
Use of encryption methods to ensure the security of data transmissions.
Understanding and application of protocols such as Diffie-Hellman for secure key transfer.
Use of hashing algorithms for secure password storage.
Using hash checksums to verify the integrity of downloaded files.
Use of certificates and SSL/TLS handshake for authentication and encryption.
Use of hashing algorithms to check the integrity of data.
Setting up firewall rules for network security on Windows and Linux.
Analyzing network protocols and packets to identify security issues.
Using packet sniffers to monitor and analyze network traffic.
Develop and implement security policies and risk management procedures.
Ensuring security aspects by restricting access, availability and integrity of data.
Identification of different types of attackers and their targets.
Protecting the confidentiality, integrity and availability of data.
Compliance with data protection laws and regulations such as the GDPR.
Identifying security vulnerabilities and monitoring networks.
Checking operating systems for security vulnerabilities and providing hardening recommendations.
Methods for identifying and securing against password attacks.
Using certificates to secure email communications.
Using specific search terms and techniques to identify vulnerabilities and sensitive information via search engines such as Google.

items.title: IT automation
items.description: Automating IT processes for efficiency and scalability.
Scripting tool for Windows to automate mouse and keyboard input;
Automated processing of images through scripts or tools for resizing, filter application or batch processing.
Automatically rename files in bulk via predefined rules or patterns.
Automated collection or integration of data from external sources such as APIs, websites or databases.
Microsoft tool for automating workflows by linking different apps and services.
Powerful tool for processing and searching texts based on patterns;
Using commands and scripts in the Linux shell (such as Bash) to automate processes, file management and system maintenance.
Powerful framework and command line interface from Microsoft for automating tasks and system management in Windows-based systems.

items.title: Database
items.description: Efficiently organize and secure databases.
Setting up databases and defining relationships between the various tables.
Use of modeling techniques like MCD and MLD for designing the database structure.
Knowledge and experience in managing different database types such as MySQL, MSSQL.
Setting up and planning backup strategies for databases.
Experience in using SQL to extract, update, delete and insert data.

items.type: Managing data in Excel and Access
items.description: Knowledge of managing and analyzing data in Excel and Access.
Extensible Markup Language (XML) is a markup language for representing hierarchical structures in the form of text files.
JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) is an easy-to-read data format based on JavaScript objects.
Comma-separated values ​​(CSV) is a file format for displaying tabular data.

items.title: Other
items.description: A look at the variety of tools and technologies I'm familiar with.
A cross-platform code editor with syntax highlighting, IntelliSense, and Git integration used by developers for software development.
A software application that allows users to transfer files between their computer and an FTP server.
A software application that allows users to securely connect to an SSH server to log in, transfer files, and execute commands.
Allows users to connect to and control a remote computer to access files, applications, and resources as if they were physically in front of the remote computer.
A network simulation tool from Cisco that allows users to design, configure, and test complex networks without requiring physical hardware.
A widely used open source web server for delivering web content to the Internet.
A web server from Microsoft for Windows Server that hosts websites, web applications, and other Internet services.
A directory service from Microsoft for managing users, groups, computers, and resources in a Windows domain.
A server that enables file transfer via the File Transfer Protocol (FTP).
A server that supports Secure Shell (SSH) to allow users to securely connect remotely and execute commands.
A user-friendly platform for creating and managing websites and blogs with numerous customization options through themes and plugins.
